ownPages.title: GroupedProjectGroups
ownPages.content:
Represents student groups that were signalled as failling exactly the same unit tests.

groups

is a List of ProjectGroup s

failedTestNames

is a List of Strings with the names of the unit tests that the groups are failing. Each String is the name of one failed test.

Represents student groups that were signalled as failling exactly the same unit tests.

getGroupIDs getGroupMembers showNrOfFailedTests getTestNames

ownPages.title: TestType
ownPages.content:
Enum representing the types of tests that DP supports:

  • Student tests - unit tests written by the students to test their own work;
  • Teacher - unit tests written by the teachers to test the student's work; The detailed results of these tests are always shown to the students.
  • Hidden Teacher Tests - unit tests written by the teachers; The results of these tests can be partially visible to the students or not (configurable when creating the assignment).
STUDENT

TEACHER

HIDDEN

ownPages.title: MavenResult
ownPages.content:
Represents the Output of a Maven build process.

resultCode

is an Int

outputLines

is a List of String

expiredByTimeout

is a Boolean

Represents the Output of a Maven build process.

tooMuchOutput

ownPages.title: AssignmentStatistics
ownPages.content:
Represents statistics about the submissions done for an Assignment.

average

is a Double, representing the average number of submissions

standardDeviation

is a Double, representing the standard deviation of the average number of submissions

groupsConsideredForStatistics

is a List with the GroupSubmissionStatistics that were considered when calculating the statistics

Represents statistics about the submissions done for an Assignment.

identifyGroupsOutsideStatisticalNorms

Identifies ProjectGroup's that have a result that is outside the nome (e.g. they pass "many tests" while having "little submissions" when compared with the other groups.

ownPages.title: BuildReport
ownPages.content:
Represents the output that is generated by Maven for a certain Submission's code.

LOG

mavenOutputLines

is a List of String, where each String is a line of the Maven's build process's output

mavenizedProjectFolder

is a String

assignment

identifies the Assignment that Submission targetted.

junitResults

is a List of JunitResults with the result of evaluating the Submission using JUnit tests

jacocoResults

is a List of JacocoResults with the result of evaluating the Submission's code coverage

assignmentTestMethods

is a List of AssignmentTestMethod . Each object describes on of the executed Unit Tests

Represents the output that is generated by Maven for a certain Submission's code.

mavenOutput mavenExecutionFailed compilationErrors

Collects from a Maven Output the errors related with the Compilation process.

checkstyleErrors

Collects from a Maven Output the errors related with the CheckStyle plugin / rules.

checkstyleValidationActive PMDerrors junitSummary junitSummaryAsObject

Creates a summary of the testing results, considering a certain TestType .

elapsedTimeJUnit

Calculates the total elapsed time during the execution of the Unit Tests. Considers both the public and the private (hidden) tests.

hasJUnitErrors

Determines if the evaluation resulted in any JUnit errors or failures.

jUnitErrors

Determines if the evaluation resulted in any JUnit errors or failures.

notEnoughStudentTestsMessage

Determines if the student's (own) Test class contains at least the minimum number of JUnit tests that are expected by the Assignment .

testResults

ownPages.title: GroupSubmissionStatistics
ownPages.content:
Represents the submission statistics for a certain ProjectGroup.

groupID

is a Long, identifying the ProjectGroup

nrPassedTests

is an Int, representing how many tests the group's (last) submission passes

nrSubmissions

is an Int, representing the number of submissions that the group performed

Represents the submission statistics for a certain ProjectGroup.

equals

ownPages.title: JUnitSummary
ownPages.content:
Represents the summary of execution of a set of JUnit Tests.

progress

numTests

is an Int

numFailures

is an Int representing the number of failed tests

numErrors

is an Int representing the number of tests that resulted in a runtime error (e.g. "ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException")

numSkipped

is an Int

ellapsed

is a Float representing the time that the execution of the tests took

Represents the summary of execution of a set of JUnit Tests.

toStr

ownPages.content:

projectGroup

is a ProjectGroup

lastSubmission

is the last (most recent) Submission performed by the ProjectGroup

allSubmissions

is a List of Submission s

Represents the Submission s that a ProjectGroup did for a certain Assignment.

ownPages.title: AuthorDetails
ownPages.content:
Represents one of the authors of a Submission. Note that the author might not be the submitter (e.g. if a group has 2 elements, both will be authors, but only one of them will be the submitter).

name

is a String

number

is a String

submitter

is a Boolean which will be true if the author object was the one performing the submission

Represents one of the authors of a Submission. Note that the author might not be the submitter (e.g. if a group has 2 elements, both will be authors, but only one of them will be the submitter).

ownPages.title: org.dropProject.data
ownPages.content:
AssignmentStatistics

Represents statistics about the submissions done for an Assignment.

GroupSubmissionStatistics

Represents the submission statistics for a certain ProjectGroup.

AuthorDetails

Represents one of the authors of a Submission. Note that the author might not be the submitter (e.g. if a group has 2 elements, both will be authors, but only one of them will be the submitter).

TestType

Enum representing the types of tests that DP supports:

  • Student tests - unit tests written by the students to test their own work;
  • Teacher - unit tests written by the teachers to test the student's work; The detailed results of these tests are always shown to the students.
  • Hidden Teacher Tests - unit tests written by the teachers; The results of these tests can be partially visible to the students or not (configurable when creating the assignment).
BuildReport

Represents the output that is generated by Maven for a certain Submission's code.

GroupedProjectGroups

Represents student groups that were signalled as failling exactly the same unit tests.

JUnitSummary

Represents the summary of execution of a set of JUnit Tests.

MavenResult

Represents the Output of a Maven build process.

SubmissionInfo

Represents the Submission s that a ProjectGroup did for a certain Assignment.

computeStatistics

Computes statistics for an Assignment, considering the statistics about each ProjectGroup's submission statistics.

Only the groups that pass more than a certain number of tests will be considered for the statistics.

getMyAssignments

Returns the Assignment s that a certain user can access. The returned assignments will be the ones that are owned by the user and also the ones that the user has been given access to.

submissionRepository

Provides functionality related with handling GitSubmission s (for example, searching for a GitSubmission in the database or deleting a GitSubmission .

ownPages.title: JUnitResults
ownPages.content:
Represents the JUnit Test results for a certain Test class.

testClassName

fullTestClassName

is a String, with the Test class name prefixed by the name of the respective package

numTests

is an Int with the number of unit tests that were executed

numErrors

is an Int with the number of unit tests that resulting in an error

numFailures

is an Int with the number of unit tests that failed

numSkipped

timeEllapsed

is a Float, representing the time that it took to execute the Test class

junitMethodResults

is a List of JUnitMethodResult with the result each unit test

Represents the JUnit Test results for a certain Test class.

isTeacherPublic

Determines if the Test class contains public tests implemented by the teacher. Public tests are tests that are designed for their results to be fully and always visible to the students that performed the Submission.

isTeacherHidden

Determines if the Test class contains private tests implemented by the teacher. Private tests are tests that are designed for their results to be invisible, or only partially visible, to the students that performed the Submission.

isStudent

Determines if the Test class contains tests implemented by the students performing the Submission.

WARNING

ERROR

ownPages.title: AssignmentValidator
ownPages.content:
This class performs validation of the assignments created by teachers, in order to make sure that they have the correct formats and include the expected plugins.

report

is a List of Info , containing warnings about the problems that were identified during the validation

testMethods

is a List of String, containing the names of the JUnit test methods that were found in the assignment's test classes. Each String will contain the name of a test method, prefixed by the name of the class where it was declared.

This class performs validation of the assignments created by teachers, in order to make sure that they have the correct formats and include the expected plugins.

validate

Validates the Assignment .

ownPages.title: JacocoResults
ownPages.content:
Represents the results from the execution of the plugin for unit coverage calculation (Jacoco).

The students test coverage is calculated by DP when the Assignment is configured to evaluate it.

linesMissed

is an Int with the number of lines that are not covered by the students' tests

linesCovered

is an Int with the number of lines that are covered by the students' tests

lineCoveragePercent

is an Int, indicating the percentage of lines that are covered

Represents the results from the execution of the plugin for unit coverage calculation (Jacoco).

The students test coverage is calculated by DP when the Assignment is configured to evaluate it.

ownPages.content:
Represents the result of executing a certain JUnit Test.

methodName

is a String with the name of the test function

fullMethodName

is a String with the full name of the test function (i.e. includes the package name)

type

is the type of the result. Possible values are "Success", "Error" or "Failure"

failureType

is a a String

failureErrorLine

is a String

failureDetail

is a String

Represents the result of executing a certain JUnit Test.

id

is a primary-key like generated value

assignmentId

userId

Represents the association between an Assignment and a user that can access it.

ownPages.title: Indicator
ownPages.content:
Enum representing the multiple evaluation criteria that a Submission can be subject to. Some of the criteria are mandatory (e.g. Compilation) while others are optional (e.g. Teacher Hidden Unit Tests).

PROJECT_STRUCTURE

COMPILATION

CHECKSTYLE

TEACHER_UNIT_TESTS

STUDENT_UNIT_TESTS

HIDDEN_UNIT_TESTS

code

description

Indicator

Enum representing the multiple evaluation criteria that a Submission can be subject to. Some of the criteria are mandatory (e.g. Compilation) while others are optional (e.g. Teacher Hidden Unit Tests).

ownPages.title: SubmissionReport
ownPages.content:
Represents a SubmissionReport, which is the status of a Submission for a certain indicator (for example, Compilation). Each Submission will have multiple such indicators.

indicator

cssLabel

id

submissionId

reportKey

is a String, matching the value of one of the existing Indicator s

reportValue

is a String

reportProgress

is an Int. It only makes sense for certain indicators, like TEACHER_UNIT_TESTS

reportGoal

is an Int. It only makes sense for certain indicators, like TEACHER_UNIT_TESTS

assignment

Represents a SubmissionReport, which is the status of a Submission for a certain indicator (for example, Compilation). Each Submission will have multiple such indicators.

progressSummary

showIcon

showItem

ownPages.title: Assignment
ownPages.content:
Represents an Assignment, which is a problem to be solved by a student or group of students.

tags

is a Set of AssignmentTag .

id

is a String that uniquely identifies the Assignment

name

is a String representing the name of the Assignment

packageName

is a String with the (optional) Assignment's expected package (e.g. all the code should be placed in this package)

dueDate

is an optional LocalDateTime with the submission deadline

submissionMethod

language

is the programming Language that the code should be written in

acceptsStudentTests

is a Boolean, indicating if the students are allowed to submit their own unit tests

minStudentTests

is an optional Integer, indicating the minimum number of unit tests that students are asked to implement

calculateStudentTestsCoverage

is an optional Boolean, indicating if the test coverage should be calculated for student's own tests

hiddenTestsVisibility

cooloffPeriod

is an optional Integer with the number of minutes that students must wait between consecutive submissions

maxMemoryMb

is an optional Integer, indicating the maximum number of Mb that the student's code can use

showLeaderBoard

is a Boolean, indicating if the leaderboard page should be active for this Assignment

leaderboardType

gitRepositoryUrl

is a String with the location of the git repository used to create the Assignment

gitRepositoryPubKey

is a String with the Public Key of the git repository

gitRepositoryPrivKey

is a String the Private Key of the git repository

gitRepositoryFolder

ownerUserId

is a String with the user id of the user that created the Assignment

active

is a Boolean indicating if the Assignment can receive submissions from students

archived

is a Boolean indicating if the Assignment has been archived

buildReportId

is a Long, representing the Id of the Assignment's BuildReport

numSubmissions

numUniqueSubmitters

public

is a Boolean, indicating if the assignment is accessible to everyone or only to registered Assignee s

lastSubmissionDate

is a Date, containing the date of the last submission performed for this Assignment

Represents an Assignment, which is a problem to be solved by a student or group of students.

dueDateFormatted

ownPages.title: AssignmentTestMethod
ownPages.content:
Represents an Assignment 's JUnit test method/function.

id

is a primary-key like generated value

assignmentId

is a String, identifying the assignment

testClass

is a String with the name of the test class

testMethod

is a String with the name of the method

Represents an Assignment 's JUnit test method/function.

ownPages.title: Author
ownPages.content:
Represents the author of a submission (a student or a teacher).

group

is a ProjectGroup , representing the group that the author belongs to

id

is a primary-key like generated value

name

is a String, representing the author's name

userId

is a String, representing the author's id (e.g. student number, teacher number)

Represents the author of a submission (a student or a teacher).

ownPages.content:

is a Long with a primary-key like generated id

submissionId

is a Long, identifying the Submission that the report is based on

fileName

is a String with the name of the Jacoco report file

xmlReport

is a String with the XML version of the report

Represents a persisted JUnitReport.

JAVA

KOTLIN

ownPages.content:
Represents a "tag" used to categorize Assignment s. It is mostly used for filtering purposes. It might take any value (e.g. the name of the course, the year, the type of evaluation, etc.).

id

is a primary-key like generated value.

name

is a String, representing the name of the tag.

selected

is a Boolean, indicating if this tag has been selected in a current filter.

Represents a "tag" used to categorize Assignment s. It is mostly used for filtering purposes. It might take any value (e.g. the name of the course, the year, the type of evaluation, etc.).

is a primary-key like generated value

assignmentId

is a String with the relevant Assignment's ID

type

is the type of the report (e.g. Warning)

message

is a short description of the problem (note that some problems only result in this message)

description

is the long description of the problem

group

is the ProjectGrop that performed the submission.

id

is a primary-key like generated value

submissionId

is a String

gitSubmissionId

is a String

submissionFolder

submissionDate

is a String identifying the user that performed the submission

is a Date representing the date and time when the Assignment's status was last updated

assignmentId

buildReportId

is a String

structureErrors

is a String

markedAsFinal

is a Boolean, indicating if this submission is marked as the group's final one. The final Submission is the one that is exported to CSV.

reportElements

ellapsed

studentTests

teacherTests

is a JUnitSummary with the result of executing the teacher's public tests

hiddenTests

is a JUnitSummary with the result of executing the teacher's hidden tests

coverage

is an Int with the test coverage percentage calculated for the submission's own unit tests

testResults

is a List of JUnitMethodResult containing the result for each evaluation JUnit Test

ownPages.title: Assignee
ownPages.content:
Represents an Assignee of an Assignment . Some assignments are private in the sense that they can only be accessed by students that were given a certain permission. This "role" of Assignee represents that permission.

id

assignmentId

is a String, identifying the Assignment

authorUserId

is a String, corresponding to the author's user id (e.g. student number)

Represents an Assignee of an Assignment . Some assignments are private in the sense that they can only be accessed by students that were given a certain permission. This "role" of Assignee represents that permission.

ownPages.title: SubmissionStatus
ownPages.content:
Enum represening the possible statuses that a Submission can be in.

The submission starts in the "Submitted" status, and then moves to another status as it is validated and tested.

Some of the statuses represent problematic situations (e.g. "TO", "Too much output").

SUBMITTED

VALIDATED

FAILED

ABORTED_BY_TIMEOUT

SUBMITTED_FOR_REBUILD

VALIDATED_REBUILT

REBUILDING

ILLEGAL_ACCESS

DELETED

TOO_MUCH_OUTPUT

code

description

SubmissionStatus

Enum represening the possible statuses that a Submission can be in.

The submission starts in the "Submitted" status, and then moves to another status as it is validated and tested.

Some of the statuses represent problematic situations (e.g. "TO", "Too much output").

ownPages.title: JacocoReport
ownPages.content:
Represents a persisted Jacoco report. The Jacoco report contains the result of calculating the code coverage of a Submission .

id

is a Long with a primary-key like generated id

submissionId

is Long is a Long, identifying the Submission that the report is based on

fileName

is a String with the name of the JUnit report file

csvReport

is a String with the CSV version of the report

Represents a persisted Jacoco report. The Jacoco report contains the result of calculating the code coverage of a Submission .

ownPages.title: org.dropProject.dao
ownPages.content:
Assignee

Represents an Assignee of an Assignment . Some assignments are private in the sense that they can only be accessed by students that were given a certain permission. This "role" of Assignee represents that permission.

Language

Enum representing the programming languages that Drop Project supports.

TestVisibility

Enum representing the types of visibility that can be applied to the results of the hidden unit tests.

LeaderboardType

Enum representing the types of Leaderboard (for example, based on Number of Passed Tests).

Assignment

Represents an Assignment, which is a problem to be solved by a student or group of students.

AssignmentACL

Represents the association between an Assignment and a user that can access it.

AssignmentReport

Represents a report of information that was generated during an Assignment 's validation. This information will be listed on the Assignments "Validation Report" page.

AssignmentTag

Represents a "tag" used to categorize Assignment s. It is mostly used for filtering purposes. It might take any value (e.g. the name of the course, the year, the type of evaluation, etc.).

AssignmentTestMethod

Represents an Assignment 's JUnit test method/function.

Author

Represents the author of a submission (a student or a teacher).

BuildReport

Represents an Assignment 's "Build Report".

GitSubmission

Represents a GitSubmission which is a Submission performed by connecting to a GitHub repository and pulling it's code.

JUnitReport

Represents a persisted JUnitReport.

JacocoReport

Represents a persisted Jacoco report. The Jacoco report contains the result of calculating the code coverage of a Submission .

ProjectGroup

Represents a set of Author s (for example, students) that interact with Drop Project as a group.

SubmissionStatus

Enum represening the possible statuses that a Submission can be in.

The submission starts in the "Submitted" status, and then moves to another status as it is validated and tested.

Some of the statuses represent problematic situations (e.g. "TO", "Too much output").

Submission

Represents a Submission, which is a single interaction of the student (or group) with an Assignment .

Indicator

Enum representing the multiple evaluation criteria that a Submission can be subject to. Some of the criteria are mandatory (e.g. Compilation) while others are optional (e.g. Teacher Hidden Unit Tests).

SubmissionReport

Represents a SubmissionReport, which is the status of a Submission for a certain indicator (for example, Compilation). Each Submission will have multiple such indicators.

UploadController is an MVC controller class to handle requests related with the upload of submissions.

getUploadForm

Controller that handles related with the base URL.

If the principal can only access one Assignment , then that assignment's upload form will be displayed. Otherwise, a list of assignments will be displayed.

getUploadForm

Controller that handles requests related with the Assignment 's upload page.

upload

Controller that handles requests for the actual file upload that delivers/submits the student's code.

upload

Controller that handles requests for the generation of a GitSubmission 's build report.

rebuild

Controller that handles requests for the Submission 's rebuild process. The rebuild process is a process where by a student's submission gets compiled and evaluated again. It can be useful, for example, in situations where an error was detected in the teacher's tests and the teacher wants to apply corrected tests to the student's submission.

rebuildFull

markAsFinal

Controller that handles requests for marking a Submission as "final". Since, by design, students' can make multiple submissions in DP, marking a submission as "final" is the way for the teacher to indicate that it's the one that shall be considered when exporting the submissions' data (e.g. for grading purposes).

Note that only one submission per ProjectGroup can be marked as final. This means that, when a certain submission is marked as final, any previously "finalized" submission by the same group will not be final anymore.

cleanup

setupStudentSubmissionUsingGitRepository

Controller that handles requests for connecting a student's GitHub repository with an Assignment available in DP.

This process works like a two step wizard. This is the first part. The second part is in "/student/setup-git-2".

connectAssignmentToGitRepository

Controller that handles requests for connecting a student's GitHub repository with DP.

This process works like a two step wizard. This is the second part. The first part is in "/student/setup-git".

refreshAssignmentGitRepository

Controller that handles requests for the creation of a new submission via Git, by refreshing the contents that are in the respective student's repository.

disconnectAssignmentToGitRepository

Controller that handles requests for the resetting of the connection between a GitHub and an Assignment.

deleteSubmission

Controller that handles requests for the deletion of a Submission .

ReportController contains MVC controller functions to handle requests related with submission reports (for example, build report, submissions list, etc.).

getSignaledGroupsOrSubmissions

Controller that handles requests for the list of signalled groups in an Assignment . The signalled groups are groups of students that are failing exactly the same tests.

getReport

Controller that handles requests for an Assignment 's report (for example, list of submissions per student/group).

getTestMatrix

Controller that handles requests for an Assignment 's Test Matrix. The Test Matrix is a matrix where each row represents a student/group and each column represents an evaluation test. The intersection between lines and columns will tell us if each group has passed each specific test.

getSubmissionReport

Controller that handles requests for a Submission 's "Build Report".

downloadMavenProject

Controller that handles the download of a specific submission's code. The submission is downloaded in a format compatible with Maven.

downloadOriginalProject

Controller that handles the download of a specific submission's code. The submission is downloaded in it's original format.

downloadOriginalAll

Controller that handles requests related with the download of ALL the students' submissions (code) for a certain Assignment. The submissions are downloaded in their original format.

downloadMavenizedAll

Controller that handles requests related with the download of ALL the students' submissions (code) for a certain Assignment . The submissions are downloaded in a format compatible with Maven.

getMySubmissions

Controller that handles requests for the submissions of the current user in a certain Assigment.

getSubmissions

Controller that handles requests related with listing Submission s of a certain Assignment and ProjectGroup .

exportCSV

Controller that handles the exportation of an Assignment's submission results to a CSV file.

getLeaderboard

Controller that handles requests for an Assignment 's Leaderboard.

ownPages.title: README
ownPages.content:
Drop Project - Continuous Auto-Grader

A web application where students drop their projects to check for correctness and quality.

Several checks are performed on each project:

  • Does it have the right folder structure and all the mandatory files?
  • Does it compile?
  • Does it pass its own tests?
  • Does it achieve a minimum coverage with its own tests?
  • Does it pass the teacher tests?
  • Does it conform to the coding guidelines defined by the teacher?
  • Does it perform well? (tests with large datasets are measured)

Requirements

  • Java 8 JDK (a compiler is needed)
  • Maven
  • Servlet Engine (Tested with tomcat and jetty)
  • MySQL

Current limitations

  • Only works for Java 8+ / Kotlin non-maven projects

How does it work?

Most of the work is done by a Maven Invoker, running several goals on the project. The results are collected into a report that is viewable by the student and the teacher.

Projects must not be maven projects because they are "mavenized" by the server, after uploading. In this context, "mavenizing", means copying the files into a proper Maven folder structure (e.g. putting the sources into /src/main/java), mixing the student files with the teacher unit tests and adding a pom.xml (also provided by the teacher).

Since checking a project may take some time, it is done asynchronously - the student submits the file and must come back later to check the report.

Quick start

After cloning the repository, change the following properties:

dropProject.maven.home=<path_to_maven_home>
dropProject.maven.repository=<path_to_maven_repository>

in the following files:

 src/main/resources/drop-project.properties
 src/test/resources/drop-project-test.properties

Note:

  • Configuring the first file will allow you to run Drop Project.
  • Configuring the second file will allow you to run Drop Project's unit tests.
  • Linux users: the Maven Home is usually in /usr/share/maven (otherwise, try: whereis maven) and the Maven Repository is in /home/USERNAME>/.m2
  • Windows users: the Maven Home is the installation directory and the Maven Repository is in c:\Users\<USERNAME>\.m2

And run the embedded tomcat runner:

mvn spring-boot:run

The application should now be accessible on http://localhost:8080

Documentation

https://github.com/drop-project-edu/drop-project/wiki/Documentation

To generate source code documentation, run:

mvn dokka:dokka

The generated documentation will be available in the following folder:

target/dokka/drop-project/index.html

Unit Tests

To execute the unit tests, run:

mvn test

Unit Test Coverage

To measure the unit test coverage, run:

mvn jacoco:report

Note: to run the coverage measurement, you must first run the unit tests themselves.

The test coverage report will be available in the following folder:

target/site/jacoco/index.html

ownPages.title: Concepts
ownPages.content:
Concepts

Assignments and Submissions

The best way to understand how Drop Project (DP) works is to start with its two main concepts: Assignments and Submissions. Assignments are created by teachers and Submissions are created by students, according to the assignment instructions. The students' goal is to pass all the tests.

Assignments

The interesting thing is that assignments are just regular maven projects (in Java or Kotlin), stored in a regular git repository - there's nothing specific to DP in them.

Users with the TEACHER role will be able to create an assignment by connecting DP with its repository and filling some information. You can see an example in https://github.com/palves-ulht/sampleJavaAssignment

The good thing is that you can code and test the assignments in your IDE, without using DP. After you finished, just connect DP to your repository. If you make further changes, just refresh the assignment in DP.

Submissions

After the assignment is marked active, students will be able to submit their projects, trying to pass all the assignment junit tests. They can submit their project by dropping a zip file or by connecting DP to a git repository containing their submission (this is specified by the teacher when she creates the assignment).

Students can submit alone or in group - they just have to include an AUTHORS.txt in their project. One of the things that students like in DP is the fact that they can submit multiple times until they pass all the tests. It's up to the teacher to determine if the number of submissions has an effect in the final grade.

The structure is the standard structure for standalone Java/Kotlin projects:

ownPages.title: Assignment Creation Tutorial
ownPages.content:
This tutorial explains how a teacher can create a new Assignment in Drop Project.

The first step is to create a git repository with the correct structure. The easiest way to do this is to clone one of the the following repositories:

https://github.com/drop-project-edu/sampleJavaAssignment

https://github.com/drop-project-edu/sampleKotlinAssignment

Structure

The structure of the repository must be the following:

+ assignment
|--- pom.xml  (includes the checkstyle and junit plugins)
|--- checkstyle.xml  (the rules to validate the code style, e.g., variables must start with lowercase)
|--- instructions.html     (optional, the assignment instructions)
|--- src
|------ main
|--------- ... (here goes the reference implementation, in maven structure)
|------ test
|--------- ... (JUnit tests that will validate students' submissions)

After the creation of the repository, the following steps should be followed in the Drop Project web-application:

  1. Login with your teacher account
  2. From the top menu, open the Manage Assignments page
  3. Press the Create Assignment blue button that appears in the bottom of the page
  4. Fill in the form - below each field there is a short description of its purpose

How to create tests

Public tests should be defined in a file whose name should be prefixed with the TestTeacher. For example, the tests for a class Person should be defined in a file called TestTeacherPerson.

Hidden tests should be defined in a file whose name should be prefixed with TestTeacherHidden. For example, TestTeacherHiddenPerson.

It is possible to have multiple test public and hidden test classes.
